item.title: [Tut] A guide to making an auto-talker
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

deoxys505:

I’m new to scar, and i have no idea why or how you added ‘i’.

Here:

[code]var
I : Integer;

begin
repeat
Inc(i); //Increase I by 1
Writeln('I = ’ + IntToStr(i)); //Display the current value of i
until i = 10; //repeat until i is equal to i
end.[/code]

I suggest you read this.

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut] A guide to making an auto-talker
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“deoxys505, post:17, topic:16614”]i was going over all the tutorials and saw this and was wondering. how do i use the until(false) function but replace it with an amount of times it should be repeated?

like[/quote]

procedure asdf;
begin
  typesend('whatever');
end;

begin
  i := 0;
  repeat
    i := i + 1;
    asdf;
  until(i = 23);
end.

‘For’ would actually be better here.

Read full topic
item.source: [Tut] A guide to making an auto-talker

item.title: [Tut] A guide to making an auto-talker
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

i was going over all the tutorials and saw this and was wondering. how do i use the until(false) function but replace it with an amount of times it should be repeated?

like

procedure asdf;
begin
  typesend('whatever');
end;

begin
  repeat
    asdf;
  until(23);
end.

item.title: [Tut] A guide to making an auto-talker
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“manillajones, post:1, topic:126124”]what about sendkeyswait?, lets say i was making a merchanter eg:

program merchant;
begin
repeat
wait(500)
sendkeyswait(‘selling rune scimmy 30k~’, 100,45);
wait(4500)
until (false);
end.[/quote]

If I remember, SendKeysWait sends all of them and waits, I’m not sure. Either way, this tutorial is a way to learn a bit more complex scripting techniques. If your interested, this is the TypeSend procedure:

procedure TypeSend(Text: string); var i: Integer; Shift: Boolean; begin for i := 1 to Length(Text) do begin Shift := (Text[i] = ':') or (Text[i] = '!') or (Text[i] = '+') or (Text[i] = '?') or (Text[i] = '<') or (Text[i] = '>') or (Text[i] = '@') or (Text[i] = '#') or (Text[i] = '$') or (Text[i] = '&') or (Text[i] = '%') or (Text[i] = '*'); if (Shift) then begin KeyDown(VK_Shift); Wait(5 + Random(20)); end; TypeByte(GetKeyCode(Text[i])); if (Shift) then begin KeyUp(VK_Shift); Wait(5 + Random(20)); end; Wait(50 + Random(120)); end; Wait(200 + Random(500)); TypeByte(13); end;

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut] A guide to making an auto-talker
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Repeat and Until work basically like this: it repeats until the condition in Until returns True. So Until(False); would run for ever since it will never return True.

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut] A guide to making an auto-talker
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

how do i use the “until (false)” thing. i made a script but…i want to make it look like im making mistakes…im new to scar and well, its kinda hard. i wanna make it repeat about 10 times then change to a different one so that it looks like well…a mistake or different typing. heres my script…[scar]program script;

const
Message1=‘Hello world!’;
Message2=‘Glow3:wave2:Buying all P-hats 500mil no noobs please!’;
Message3=‘glow3:wave2:buying all party hats 500mil!!!’;

procedure Hello;
begin
wait(1000)
Writeln(Message1);
end;

procedure Phats;
begin
wait(5000)
writeln(Message2);
end;

procedure hats;
begin
wait(7500)
writeln(message2)
end;

begin
Hello;
Phats;
repeat
hats;
until(false)
end.[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut] A guide to making an auto-talker
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:3, topic:16614”]Your “AutoTalkerMedium” does not work.

You can’t use a Const of Word because Word is already taken so when you try to run the script, you’ll get a type mismatch. Replace your script, with this script.

Program AutoTalkerMedium;

const
  Word1 = 'This is our "first" string to send.';
  Word2 = 'This is our "second" string to send.';

procedure SendString(text : string);
var
  TempInt, TempInt1 : Integer;
  TempChar : Char;
begin
  for TempInt := 1 to Length(text) do
  begin
    TempChar := StrGet(text, TempInt);
    TempInt1 := GetKeyCode(TempChar);
    KeyDown(TempInt1);
    Wait(45 + Random(30));
    KeyUp(TempInt1);
  end;
end;

begin
  SendString(Word1);
  SendString(Word2);
end.

Also your script, doesn’t press enter lol.[/quote]

Awell, not bad with no testing.

I’ve fixed the script up. I might load another one today, that can send "£ and stuff.

Read full topic
item.source: [Tut] A guide to making an auto-talker

item.title: [Tut] A guide to making an auto-talker
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Your “AutoTalkerMedium” does not work.

You can’t use a Const of Word because Word is already taken so when you try to run the script, you’ll get a type mismatch. Replace your script, with this script.

Program AutoTalkerMedium;

const
  Word1 = 'This is our "first" string to send.';
  Word2 = 'This is our "second" string to send.';

procedure SendString(text : string);
var
  TempInt, TempInt1 : Integer;
  TempChar : Char;
begin
  for TempInt := 1 to Length(text) do
  begin
    TempChar := StrGet(text, TempInt);
    TempInt1 := GetKeyCode(TempChar);
    KeyDown(TempInt1);
    Wait(45 + Random(30));
    KeyUp(TempInt1);
  end;
end;

begin
  SendString(Word1);
  SendString(Word2);
end.

Also your script, doesn’t press enter lol.

Read full topic
